title: Federal Register 2.0
abstract:
Federal Register 2.0
A much more visual, much more usable Federal Register is proposed, a 100-day project that will 
lay the groundwork for a fundamental change in how the United States distributes the Ofﬁcial 
Journals of Government and how citizens participate in the rulemaking process.  The long-term 
goal is for all primary legal materials issued by all 3 branches of the U.S. Government to be 
readily available on the Internet, making America’s Operating System open source.
